content:
Hey all, I hope I'm in the right place for asking questions about Rowan

I'm in the process of moving a handmade implementation of an AST with indextree to rowan, and for I wanted to know if this was doable:
When the file I'm currently compiling specifies imports, I recursively build the referred module and its dependencies until I've compiled all files and have a module root for each file. I currently have them attached to a common AST by means of a top-level root module for each "package", and child modules as required for each level in the fully qualified path to the referred module

I'm attempting the same with rowan where I have a root module for each package, then append empty child modules to the needed parent module (if one isn't present already) until I reach the path required, and then append the compiled module as a child. I'm currently trying to use splice_children for this. Could I know if I'm on the right path?
